option:
Specifies the maximum operand width (bits per number) for which the arithmetic analysis uses modular formulas (residues) in comparisons (<, <=, =, >=, >). For wider numbers the non-modular, unbounded integer comparisons are used. If the number is zero, modular formulas are never used. Note that the value of the option is automatically increased to at least 2**(calc_mod_max).
WARNING: Modular arithmetic analysis is experimental and often fails, perhaps by aborting the Omega Calculator.
